field.label: Enable Indexing
field.comment: If set to No, Algolia extension will simply be disabled.

field.label: Enable Search
field.comment: If set to No, search will be done by Algolia but renderered by Magento

field.label: Enable Logging
field.comment: NOTICE: Debug logging generates a significant amount of data and can affect performance of indexing

field.label: Application ID
field.comment:
Your Application ID, which can be found in the Credentials section of your Algolia account.
You can find your Application ID and API keys in Algolia dashboard.

field.label: Search-only (public) API key
field.comment:
A search-only API key (will be included in the public JavaScript code)
You can find your Application ID and API keys in Algolia dashboard.

field.label: Admin API key
field.comment:
Your administration API key (keep it private!)
You can find your Application ID and API keys in Algolia dashboard.

field.label: Index Name Prefix
field.comment: If configured, all indices created by the Algolia search extension will be prefixed by this value.

field.label: Enable Auto-completion Menu
field.comment: If set to Yes, the seach box will display a search-as-you-type drop-down menu. It requires your theme to expose a top.search and content block.

field.label: Enable Instant Search Results Page
field.comment:
If set to Yes, the products inside the results pages will be searchable the refined results updated as-you-type. It requires your theme to expose a top.search and content block.

⚠ Enabling instant search can potentially break your design, some work will be required to have a good integration into your theme products.

group.label: Autocomplete
group.comment: To customize autocomplete menu beyond its configuration, you can read tutorials: How to customize autocomplete, How to add external data source, How to use backend events

field.label: Number of products
field.comment: The number of products (>=1) suggested in the autocomplete dropdown. Default value is 6

field.label: Number of categories
field.comment: The number of categories (>=1) suggested in the autocomplete dropdown. Default value is 2

field.label: Number of queries
field.comment: The number of queries suggestions (0 to disabled it) suggested in the autocomplete dropdown. Default value is 0

field.label: Min query popularity
field.comment: The min number of times a query has been performed in order to be suggested. Default value is 1000.

field.label: Min number of products per query
field.comment: The min number of results a query needs to return to be suggested. Default value is 2. <br /n>

field.label: Additional Sections
field.comment:
Configure here the additional auto-completion menu sections you want include in the dropdown menu (Ex. Suggestions, Pages, Manufacturer, Colors).

⚠ All attributes used here must have been initially included in the Attributes Configuration panel and configured as a facet in the Instant Search Results Page Configuration panel to be able to refine on the specific attribute.

field.label: Excluded Pages
field.comment:
Configure here the pages you don't want to search in.
Pages' indexing documentation: https://community.algolia.com/magento/doc/m2/indexing/#pages-indexing

⚠ Do not forget to trigger the Algolia Search indexers whenever you modify those settings.

field.label: Render template directives
field.comment:
For CMS pages, template directives (e.g. {{block type="core/template" ...}}) will be processed by default. Set this to "No" if you don't want to have template content indexed.

⚠ Do not forget to trigger the Algolia Search indexers whenever you modify those settings.

group.label: Instant Search Results Page
group.comment: To customize instant search results page beyond its configuration, you can read tutorials: How to customize instantsearch, How to use backend events

field.label: DOM Selector
field.comment: The DOM selector used to inject the results using JavaScript.

field.label: Facets
field.comment:
Configure here the filtering options you want to display on your search results page. Choose Disjunctive to allow the selection of different values of a facet (e.g. hotels with 4 OR 5 stars). Choose Conjunctive to allow the selection of only one value of a facet (e.g. only "Size M").
Facets' documentation: https://community.algolia.com/magento/doc/m2/indexing/#facets

field.label: Number of values per facet
field.comment: The number of values each facet can display. Default value is 10.

field.label: Sorts
field.comment:
Configure here the different sorting options you want to offer.
Sorts documentation: https://community.algolia.com/magento/doc/m2/indexing/#sorting-strategies

The extension will create :
- 1 index/store
- 1 index/store/sort

Which means that for an instance with:
- 2 stores (2 languages for example)
- 100 products
- 2 sorts on price (asc, desc)
- 2 sorts on date (asc, desc)

You have 100 * 2 + 100 * 4 * 2 = 1000 product records You can reduce the number of records by removing some sort

field.label: Replace categories page
field.comment: Choose here if you want the default Magento category pages to be replaced by an instant-search results page when a category is selected either in the menu of categories or in the drop-down menu.

field.label: Add to Cart
field.comment: Choose here if you want to add an "add to cart" button in the template.

field.label: Number of products per page in the instant result page
field.comment: The number of products displayed on the instant search results page. Default value is 9.

field.label: Attributes
field.comment:
Choose here the product attributes your users can search on, the ones you want to use as filters and sorts options and the ones required to display the search results.
Searchable attributes' documentation: https://community.algolia.com/magento/doc/m2/indexing/#searchable-attributes

The order of the searchable attributes matters: a query matching the first searchable attribute of a product will put this product before the others in the results. Chose "Ordered" if you want the position of the matching word(s) inside the attribute to matter. A match at the beginning of an attribute will be considered more important: for the query "iPhone", "iPhone 5s" will be ranked before "case for iPhone".

⚠ Do not forget to reindex your Algolia Search index after you've modified this panel.

field.label: Ranking
field.comment:
Configure here the attributes that reflect the popularity of your product (number of orders, number of likes, number of views, ...).
What is Custom ranking? https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/relevance/sorting/#sort-by-relevance-using-the-custom-ranking

field.label: Show most popular queries suggestions when there are no results
field.comment: Choose here if you want to show most popular queries suggestions when there are no results/

field.label: Index out of stock options for configurable products
field.comment: Choose here if you want to index out of stock options for configurable products

field.label: Attributes
field.comment:
Configure here the category attributes your users can search on. The order of these attributes matters: the higher in the list, the more important to rank the results.
Searchable attributes' documentation: https://community.algolia.com/magento/doc/m2/indexing/#searchable-attributes-1

⚠ Do not forget to reindex your Algolia Search index after you've modified this panel.

field.label: Ranking
field.comment:
Choose here the attributes that reflect the popularity of your categories (number of products, total number of sales of the category,etc.).
What is Custom ranking? https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/relevance/sorting/#sort-by-relevance-using-the-custom-ranking

⚠ Do not forget to reindex your Algolia Search index after you've modified this panel.

field.label: Show categories that are not included in the navigation menu
field.comment: If set to Yes, Algolia will display all categories in both the autocomplete menu and instant search page ignoring the setting: "Include in navigation menu". Default value: No

group.label: Images
group.comment: If you have issues with images: https://community.algolia.com/magento/faq/#why-are-images-not-showing-up

field.label: Height
field.comment:
You can specify the size of the images used at the Search Results Page.
If your images are already present in some size, eg. 265x265, Algolia's index job may not have to resize those, potentially saving time and resources.

field.label: Type
field.comment: The image used at the Search Results Page.

field.label: Queue Enabled
field.comment:
If enabled, all indexing operations (add, remove & update operations) will be done asynchronously using the CRON mechanism.

To schedule the run you need to add this in your crontab:
*/5 * * * * php /absolute/path/to/magento/bin/magento indexer:reindex algolia_queue_runner

⚠ Enabling this option is recommended in production or if your store has a lot of products.

field.label: Number of jobs to run each time the cron is run
field.comment:
Number of jobs to run each time the cron is run. Default value is 10.

⚠ Each time the cron runs it will process ("Max number of element per indexing job" * "Number of jobs to run each time the cron is run") products.

field.label: Enable Synonyms Management
field.comment: If set to No, synonyms will be managed only in Algolia's dashboard and won't get to be overriden by Magento.

field.label: Synonyms
field.comment:
Synonyms are defined by a comma-separated list of words that should be considered equivalent by the Algolia engine.
For instance: tv, television, tv set
Using that set, if a record contains “television” and a user searches for “TV”, this record will be returned.
Documentation: https://www.algolia.com/doc/synonyms#synonyms

field.label: One-way Synonyms
field.comment:
One-way synonyms allow you to define alternative words for a search term, which are not synonyms to each others.
Let’s take an example: when a user searches for “tablet”, you want him to be able to find iPads and Galaxy Note tablets alike, but you might not want Android tablets to show up when he searches for “iPad”.
To do this, you’d define a one-way synonyms set between tablet (as input) and ipad, galaxy note (as synonyms). When the user types in “tablet”, records containing “iPad” and “Galaxy Note” will be returned. However records containing only “tablet” or “Galaxy Note” won’t be returned if he searches for “iPad”.
Documentation: https://www.algolia.com/doc/synonyms#one-way-synonyms

Algolia offers more synonymys’ types - placeholders and alternative corrections. These types can be managed directly from your Algolia’s dashboard. Any changes you will make to placeholders and alternative corrections in Algolia’s dashboard won’t be overriden.

field.label: Synonyms File
field.comment:
If you have large amount of synonyms (appr. more than hundred), you don't have to fill it into inputs above and you can upload a JSON file with synonyms instead. The documentation with the file structure can be found here.

⚠ When you upload a JSON file, all the synonyms settings from above will be ignored and only synonyms from the JSON file will be pushed to Algolia.

field.label: Delay (in milliseconds)
field.comment:
When the search bar is used, each keystroke triggers a search in Algolia. It’s really good for an instantsearch and as-you-type search UX, but it’s not that good for analytics as it generates a lot of data and brings a lot of noise to the analytics. The delay variable defines how long the widget should wait between keystrokes before pushing data to analytics - only the last search will be pushed.
Default value: 3000

field.label: Trigger the push function before the the delay on UI interaction
field.comment:
If the user selects a search result even before the push was trigger (because of the delay variable), the push to analytics might never be called. With this parameter you can trigger a data push to analytics if the user interacts with the search results during the delay.
Default value: Yes

field.label: Trigger the push function after the initial search
field.comment:
Sometimes your customers come directly to the search page from a link, so a search is triggered automatically without any action from the user. At the same time, the load of the page triggers standard Google Analytics code to track the page view. By this parameter you can specify if you want to trigger a data push on this kind of search scenario.
Default value: No

field.label: Max number of element per indexing job
field.comment: The max number of element by indexing job. Default value is 100.

field.label: Remove Words If No Result
field.comment:
Optional property to avoid empty result pages.
By default, Algolia performs "AND" queries, which can lead to no results pages when queries are too long or too detailed. To avoid this, you can select among the following options:
LastWords: when a query does not return any result, the last word will be considered as optional and the query will be automatically performed again (the process is repeated with the n-1 word, n-2 word, ... until there is results).
FirstWords: when a query does not return any result, the first word will be considered as optional and the query will be automatically performed again (the process is repeated with the second word, third word, ... until there is results).
allOptional: when a query does not return any result, all words will be optional.
None: No specific processing is done when a query does not return any result.

field.label: Partial Updates
field.comment: If enabled, all add/update operations will use partialUpdateObjects instead of addObjects. You should enable this option if you update some attributes of your records from an external source in addition to Magento to avoid any overriding.

field.label: Customer Groups
field.comment:
If enabled, the extension will take into account your customer groups and display the price of the logged-in group instead of the default price.
Enabling this option creates an index per customer group.

field.label: Remove /pub/ from image URLs
field.comment: If enabled, path like example.com/pub/media/image.jpg will become example.com/media/image.jpg. Activate this if your server is set to use the pub/ directory as root directory.

field.label: Make SEO request
field.comment: Choose if a query to Algolia is done by the backend for SEO when instant search is enabled

field.label: Remove branding logo
field.comment: Choose here if the algolia logo is added to the drop-down template.

field.label: Search input DOM Selector
field.comment: If you don't have the top.search block you can specify the selector of your search input here to use it. Default value is .algolia-search-input

field.label: Update product on category products update
field.comment: This feature enables the extension to automatically update the product index when a product is added to or removed from a category via the "Catalog > Categories" menu. By default the feature is turned on.

group.label: Advanced - Extra Algolia indices settings
group.comment:
Here, you can specify additional Algolia indices settings which can be applied only programatically via one of Algolia API clients.

To set an extra settings, please fill the right textarea with JSON where you specify the extra settings.
Example: {"exactOnSingleWordQuery":"word"}

List of possible settings: https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-client/default/settings/#index-settings-parameters

⚠ Edit extra settings only when you're sure what you're doing. Bad settings can effect your search functionality and have a bad impact on your relevance.
